2315.verse: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?"

2316.verse: And the disbeliever says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"

2317.verse: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?

2318.verse: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.

2319.verse: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.

2320.verse: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.

2321.verse: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.

2322.verse: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.

2323.verse: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"

2324.verse: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?

2325.verse: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."

2326.verse: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.
